page.title: 05HOUSING IN NETHERBURY
page.content: This area covers two small villages - Netherbury and Stoke Abbott - and a small part of their nearest town, Beaminster. There is one magnificent Tudor mansion, Parnham, famous now for its find Woodwork School. Homes range from large old houses to small cottages, all built in local stone and many thatched, with a few modern houses and bungalows, mostly built in stone to blend with the old. There are also several outlying farms. On some of the best sites, with lovely views, one finds a row of council houses for renting, though now some are owned by their former tenants. Most homes are privately owned, well maintained and modernised; some only holiday homes. 2 new groups of retirements flats with wardens are now being constructed in Beaminster, one for private sale, the other Council.
